(Note by the Secretary)The Prime Minister has requested the following Committee to consider what steps should be taken to expedite the settlement of the classes of persons entitled, under the Sutton Judgment, to additional payments, and to advise as to the arrangements necessary to cause the payments to be made with the least possible delay:-The Postmaster General (Chairman), The Under Secretary of State for War,The Parliamentary and Financial Secretary to -the Admiralty,The Solicitor-General,The Paymaster-General,withMr. R.B. Howorth as Secretary.(Signed) M.P.A. HANKEY.2, Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I. 19th June, 1923.
